item.description:
The Emerald Necklace--a chain of linked urban parks spanning 5 miles--is the only remaining INTACT linear park designed by Frederick Law Olmstead ... and it's right here in Boston! Let's take advantage of this wonderful public resource by exploring the necklace with 3 leisurely "hikes" over the course of the summer:

HIKE 1 (June 26) -- The Fenway to Jamaica Pond and back
HIKE 2 (July 24) -- Arnold Arboretum to Franklin Park and back
HIKE 3 (August 21) -- The Boston Common to the Fenway and back

Here's a map of the Emerald Necklace

Come to 1, 2 or all 3 hikes!



This event is HIKE 3: The Boston Common to the Fenway (and back)
Distance = ??? mi / Difficulty = Easy / Time = ??? hrs



[details to follow....]

For this hike you'll need: comfortable athletic shoes or light hiking boots and an extra pair of socks; sunscreen or a visored hat; bug spray (if this kind of thing bothers you); bottled water; snacks and a bagged lunch. Bring your camera!



To get to our starting point: [details to follow....]



!!! Rain cancels the hike -- I will confirm cancellation via email !!!




Want to know more about the Emerald Necklace? Check out the website

See you on the Common!

Anor ...



--> Boston Photo Peeps will be joining us for this event <--
item.name: "Hiking" the Emerald Necklace -- HIKE 3: The Boston Common to the Fenway
